channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Scott Bessent working on another $20 billion of Argentina financing with private banks, sovereign funds, ‘more focused on the debt market’
item.description: Trump has suggested that the money could be pulled if Javier Milei's party does not prevail in the Oct. 26 midterm elections.

item.title: Verizon exec tells unemployed Gen Z they can always volunteer to stand out in the current bleak job market: ‘No one’s going to say no to free work’
item.description: As millions of young grads face unemployment, Verizon’s talent chief insists that even unpaid and informal experience can set candidates apart.

item.title: Bitmine chair Tom Lee says the ‘bubble has burst’ in digital asset treasury companies
item.description: A famed crypto analyst, Lee has led an Ethereum-focused DAT since June.

item.title: From pilots to powering sustainable growth: the C-suite blueprint for physical AI
item.description: We are witnessing this technology advance beyond the digital world right before our eyes.

item.title: Gen Z’s digital native status is a double-edged sword. They have cyber blind spots
item.description: By 2030, Gen Z will make up roughly 30% of U.S. workers, which means businesses can’t afford to wait.

item.title: U.S. stocks off to a higher start with earnings optimism driving gains
Nestle sees biggest one-day share surge since 2008 on earnings beat, layoffs
